Address: 382 Wild Cherry Road Lockwood South VIC 3551
Description:
Farmlet Property With A Lot That You Want
Picture yourself sitting down in the cool of the day on the outdoor area overlooking the 8 acres and a beautiful dam with wild animals coming in for a drink.
This property is made for those people wanting a tree-change or a property where they can pursue some limited agricultural pursuits to encourage the land to continue to be people friendly.
It lends itself to lavender farming or olive growing. There is plenty of land around the family sized 4 bedroom house that can be continued to be developed as mainly a native garden to encourage the native fauna and a host of different birds.
Inside this steel framed home are 4 bedrooms of good size and a study.
There are two living rooms and a Shaker style kitchen with a huge dining area.
Also in this room is a wood fired stove for heating with comfy chairs to relax in on those cool wet days that can happen in winter.
The internal house is serviced by a built in ducted heating and cooling system to ensure your comfort all year round.
The house has had all older draperies removed and they are replaced by pull down blinds to control the heat etc; this makes the house suitable for those with breathing problems.
Outside there is a country style garden and five huge rainwater tanks to help with keeping the garden growing. There is a shed to accommodate three vehicles and storage as well as one that can take up to 10 vehicles, boats or be used as construction base for work-shopping. There is a tree
lined entry to the property of native trees which could be improved if necessary.
This property has many features which are well worth a look when considering your future place of living.
* Large 4 bedroom home
* Big kitchen & dining area
* Gas log fire in dining
* Ducted cooling
* Concrete alfresco with scenic views
* Set on approx 3.5 hectares
* 5 x 28,000 ltr water tanks
* 2 megalitre dam
* Shed 1: 18 x 9 mtrs with power & concrete
* Shed 2: 14 x 6 mtrs with power & concrete
* Quiet surroundings with plenty of space
* Ideal for car enthusiast
Insights: 382 Wild Cherry Road, Lockwood South VIC 3551 was last sold in 2020 and 8 other 4 bedroom house in Lockwood South have recently been sold.

Description:
A Hidden Gem
To find this hidden treasure, turn left onto the Calder Alternative Highway from either Lockwood Road or Crusoe Road. You will pass the hall, bowls club, tennis courts, former Happy Jacks Emporium, bus stops, the Glen Road Recreation Reserve and sporting oval and Lockwood South Primary School.
From the highway, turn right onto the Bendigo-Maldon Road, cross the Bullock Creek, turn left onto Panorama Road and then left into the private, quiet and leafy neighbourhood of Brooke Street. Located just 11mins from Kangaroo Flat.
Positioned at the end of the road; the property has been very well fenced and measures 3,202m2 - more than three quarters of an acre. Bullock Creek meanders past the northern boundary and is lined by centuries old majestic gums - a stunning natural outlook.
No time wasting or unnecessary expense. Approved Planning Permit and an Endorsed Plan to build a 25 square 4 bedroom home with double garage and a separate shed.
This is an ideal address to build your dream family home in the friendly community of Lockwood South. There is a school bus stop at the end of Panorama Road.
A copy of the Planning Permit and the Endorsed Plans are available on request.

Address: Lot 2 Bendigo-St Arnaud Road Newbridge VIC 3551
Description:
Fantastic Acreage Ideal For Grazing, Cropping or Viticulture
This is an excellent, and rare, opportunity to purchase land in the Newbridge community just 30km from Bendigos CBD and 170km from Melbourne.
At just over 200 acres, the allotment consists of two titles and includes permanent spring water of a drinkable quality.
Fronting the Wimmera Highway, the property is available to both single and 3-phase power and includes a good standard of fencing whilst the layout of the acreage also enjoys the option for an off-grid power supply using wind and solar technology.
The earth consists of a combination of deep black soils and volcanic basalt and the current owners have established a business yielding organic export and domestic hay, along with prime lamb production. The land is NASAA (#3720) certified organic farmland providing an outstanding opportunity to generate a diverse range of activities from horticulture to viticulture to grazing or, alternatively, sell to existing allotments or subdivide and on-sell land to lifestyle purchasers for residential development (STCA).
Positioned on the Wimmera Highway and with easy access to Newbridge, Bridgewater, Marong, Bendigo and Melbourne, this flexible opportunity will allow the buyer multiple options including the chance to continue farming a certified organic operation; convert to traditional farming or establish an alternative mixed farming enterprise. The practical location would also be ideal for transport operators seeking a depot, bulk handling facility or freight exchange set up.

Description:
Pioneer Rise Estate - Strathfieldsaye's newly released sub-division
- Outstanding building blocks available ranging in size from 609m2 to 832m2
- Strathfieldsaye's newly released sub-division offers all services and has a lovely rural outlook
- Level 1 filled areas - filling if any is compacted to achieve a similar or better density than natural ground, so no significant cost to build on the level 1 filled areas
- Pioneer Rise Estate is serviced by underground electricity, natural gas, town water, NBN ready, planning permits to build are also in place for each dwelling. All you require is your building permit
- Bushfire Attack Levels (BAL ratings) Lots 8-13, 20-32, 35-41- BAL 12.5. Lots 33 & 34 - BAL 29. All other lots are not in a BMO so Bal ratings are likely to be minima
- Growing suburb of Strathfieldsaye, fabulous community with all amenities
- Location is on the corner of Ryalls Lane and Guys Hill Road, Strathfieldsaye
This fabulous new sub-division only just now released offers families an opportunity to buy a lovely block in the fast growing suburb of Strathfieldsaye. A great family community where people enjoy living and take advantage all that Strathfieldsaye has to offer as well as being only minutes to the Bendigo CBD.

Description:
Refreshed Country Style Huntly Home
Continue to create beautiful family memories inside this impeccably refreshed country style home in Huntly.
Set along the Midland Highway just 600m from Huntly Primary Schools, sits this well presented four-bedroom home on over 1700m2 boasting space, practicality, storage and plenty of lifestyle offerings.
From the neat front landscaped gardens, stunning polished timber flooring, high ceilings, dado boards, inviting double door entries, and ornate country features through to the neutral colour palette - it'll feel like home the moment you step onto the property.
Throughout the winter months, cosy up around the wood burning fireplaces in both the lounge and living rooms, and enjoy the air flow in each room through the warmer seasons with ceiling fans and ducted cooling throughout.
The owners have continued to pour love into the home's bathroom; its refurbishment seeing decorative tiling, striking claw foot tub and vanity.
Fill the house with the aroma of baking from your neat and spacious kitchen equipped with the essential appliances, overhead storage cupboards and ample preparation bench space.
A mix of different built-in robes in the bedrooms, linen press in the laundry and large pantry in the kitchen will appeal to those looking for extra storage space.
The secure backyard is set to continue to impress with the home's beautifully presented gardens, inviting veranda space, shady trees and an impressive array of outside storage including; a 6.4m x 6m carport, 5.6m x 2.4m shed, a 6m x 4m garage and wood shed.
A new roof and all services available including gas, power and sewer adds to this property's appeal.
Just 1km to Huntly IGA and Bakery and a short drive to Epsom Shopping Village, or continue onto Bendigo CBD.

Description:
Family Home for the Future
Lovely 4 bedroom family home , immaculately kept, with all of the modern conveniences. Ducted heating plus an air-conditioner provide comfort all year round. The compact kitchen equipped with stainless steel dishwasher, gas hot plates, electric oven and canopy, alongside the island bench and meals area, is very practical. Master bedroom is fitted with en-suite and walk-in robe. 3 bedrooms have built-in robes. Spacious open plan living leads to an enclosed outdoor barbeque area. Low maintenance backyard is tidy and secured with full colorbond fencing. Double garage with auto panel-lift door allows secure access indoors. Just minutes from local amenities such as schools, shopping precinct, many sporting facilities and public transport and a short drive into central Bendigo.

Description:
Magnificent Rural Escape
Easy access to Calder Fwy via Elphingstone
- Pristine 360-degree panoramic views
- 2 Catchment dams
- New access road to frontage
- Frontage to Axe Creek Water Reserve in East
- Power traverses site
- 2 ML water entitlement is available subject to conditions of supply
- Within 1 hour 20 mins to Melbourne and 15 mins to Bendigo
New fencing along most of the Southern and Western Boundaries and 2-metre high kangaroo exclusion fencing to North Boundary.
Tree-lined watercourses and scattered stands of trees across the property
This property offers a unique opportunity for a buyer wanting peace and tranquillity and a chance to establish a landmark rural homestead close to Victoria's 3rd largest regional centre.

Description:
SOMETHING SPECIAL
Located in one of Bendigo's prime locations, this architect-designed home offers a ready-made solution for a disabled family member or the versatility to convert it to a stunning home.
The passive solar designed residence features a U-shaped footprint with a central courtyard, high-pitched double gable roof line and timber decking to three sides.
The main body of the home features a large living room with big North-facing glass doors to the timber deck, a separate dining/sitting room, two good-sized bedrooms, bathroom, laundry and a well-equipped kitchen overlooking the courtyard.
The remaining wing consists of a king-size bedroom, disabled bathroom, storeroom, living area with external access and a distinctive spa room. With a little imagination and tweaking, this area would make a desirable parents zone.
Additional highlights include high ceilings, quality floor coverings, timber kitchen cabinetry, internal/external wheelchair access, split system heating/cooling and security system.
Set well back from the street on an unusually large block approx 2508m², (½ acre), the landscaped grounds feature a curved bitumen driveway winding past terraced lawns and gardens to a double garage.
Enjoy sun-drenched outdoor living on the timber deck overlooking serene rear gardens complete with established citrus trees, rose gardens, wisteria-draped arbour, banks of flowering shrubs and perennials, vegetable/herb beds, a garden shed and rear gate access to a native treed reserve.
The one-of-a-kind property is mere moments from all Strathdale amenities and a quick commute to the CBD.
Let this tranquil house and garden be your therapy; it offers a unique blend of style and substance with everything in place for a balanced lifestyle.

Description:
Family Friendly & FHO Eligible
This fabulous four bedroom family home sits proudly on a large corner allotment with side access at 600sqm.
Featuring a double lock-up garage and fully landscaped yard (with an automatic irrigation system installed), there's nothing to do but move in and enjoy! And this will be easy with great open plan living and dining space and great undercover alfresco area.
The kitchen offers 900mm wide stainless steel gas oven, cooktop and rangehood, stone benchtops and walk-in pantry.
All bedrooms are generous sizes with the main bedroom featuring walk-in robe and ensuite. Remaining bedrooms offer built-in robes.
The home ensures year-round comfort with ducted heating and cooling.
Families will love the proximity to the playground, as well as proximity to St. Francis Primary.
There is so much to love about the location and the home itself, so contact Briohny today!

GOLDFIELDS LAND IS WAITING YOU TO DISCOVER IT
Located at the edge of Tarnagulla in the heart of the Golden Triangle is this 6 block property of around 4600 m2 total, in the area of the spectacular Ghost gums and native flora. Open plan generous living/dining room facing tropical front garden

Recently fully painted walls and ceilings
This charming terrace house is absolutely ideal for a buyer seeking a low-maintenance option in the heart of the city. Perfect for investors or an owner-occupier, the property offers convenience and ease of living in a fantastic, tightly-held central locale

Description:
Versatile property, endless possibility!
Attention those looking for a historic, character rich and versatile property. The search is over! This well sized mixed use property boasts an array of opportunity for any investor, start up business owner or tradie and is located within an ever growing pocket of Long Gully and only a 5 minute drive to the CBD of Bendigo.
Formerly the Long Gully Milk Bar and once a butchers store, this shopfront and residence offers a high profile location/street frontage close to Long Gullys busiest intersection and best facilities.
The 10 x 5-metre shop floor is light filled and has a spacious cellar beneath, the large kitchen has been recently renovated with a stainless steel finish across bench-tops and appliances throughout. It offers a large dry store area and separate bathroom with toilet, vanity and walk in shower.
Flowing off the hallway from the kitchen space you will find two large separate rooms that offers potential to be accommodation/bedrooms, office space or living areas. Both rooms are filled with original character features; timber floor boards, original fire place, high ceilings and classic light fittings. The rear segment of the property presents in a stripped back condition, ready for it's next chapter to be renovated and converted to a separate residence.
This is a site that offers an array of options. Lending itself to the possibility of becoming a convenience store, specialty café or professional rooms consulting rooms (STCA).
One option it presents is to lease the shop and residence separately; another to combine the two as a mixed use investment. Alternatively you could view the purchase as a long-term proposition and renovate the whole, returning it to exclusively a residence with an abundance of character.
The property is allocated on a sizable 586 Sqm block (approximately) and supplies side access through to the rear of the block using a garage door located at the front right hand side of the shop front.
The possibilities of this property are limitless, all that's required is the vision.
Vendors Instructions are clear, sell!
Contact us to book your digital inspection with the agent.
(ENOE)

Description:
Investors, First Home Owners & Down-sizers Look No Further!
Situated just minutes from the Huntly shops and primary school, we have 39 Aspect Drive.
A fantastic option for investors, first home owners and down-sizers alike. With Hard wearing sleek tiles in all high traffic areas and a fully landscaped yard this one is sure to impress.
With 3 good sized bedrooms, master with its own ensuite and walk-in robe and the 2nd and 3rd bedroom offering built-in robes. As well as a great size living zone which leads out onto fully entertainers alfresco deck. This alfresco area is completely surrounded by zip track blinds to really make this such a versatile space, while enjoying fully landscaped gardens.
The construction is rock solid with fantastic fittings and beautiful caesar stone bench-tops in the kitchen along with gas appliances.
The main bathroom is generously proportioned with separate bathtub and separate toilet.
Year round comfort is assured with ducted heating a split system for the warmer months. While your hip-pocket will certainly appreciate the solar panels to ease the stress of bills!

Description:
WHEN SIZE DOES MATTER
If you have a large or blended family and love entertaining, this home will accommodate them all and some.
Set on an oversized block approx 1854m², it has space to spare with four bedrooms, two bathrooms, and formal lounge or parents retreat opposite the master suite. A study opens off the tiled entry hall and the spacious light-filled, open-style kitchen/dining/family basks in the winter sunshine. A separate rumpus and a multi-purpose/sunroom with external access complete the home.
What more could a family need what about a 13 x 5m solar-heated pool? Or a triple garage with internal access, and 9 x 6m Colorbond shed/workshop with twin roller doors, concrete floor, power and water?
The home boasts a host of extras like ducted heating/cooling and a feature gas log fire in the family room, galley-style kitchen with gas/electric cooking, dishwasher, triple pantry and long island bench.The sunroom opens to the pool area and doubles as a 5th bedroom or home gym If desired while the rumpus is located handy to the children's bedrooms.
Outside, the double-width block has three rainwater tanks, side access to the backyard and shed and ample room for parking caravans, tradie's vehicles etc.
Embraced by low maintenance landscaping, this property offers the relaxed, resort-style lifestyle most families just dream of.
